result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregary D Garel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. With huber. Consec to any other sentences. Stayed for 2 yrs probation (16CF1633).

9/24/15 Crt orders ct 1 to be amended to 1 yr probation (prev 2 yrs)

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
May not touch any container containing alcohol.  Maintain absolute sobriety. May not live anywhere where alcohol is present. May not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.

Write a letter to Judge Daley apologizing for jeopardizing his program within 30 days. Def to provide to agent to provide to Judge Daley.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

$250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW Surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety. May not touch any container containing alcohol. May not live anywhere where alcohol is present. May not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.

Write a letter to Judge Daley apologizing for jeopardizing his program within 30 days. Def to provide to agent to provide to Judge Daley.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
